title: Auto Action Tray Tour
description: Learn how to use the Auto Action Tray and its controls.

steps.title: Auto Action Tray Overview
steps.content:
The Auto Action Tray is your central hub for quickly accessing abilities, items, spells, skills, and utilities during play.

Features

  • Displays the character portrait and hit points
  • Provides separate trays for static, custom, and ability actions
  • Includes buttons for fast forward, target helper, tray configuration, and more
  • Supports skill checks, saving throws, conditions, dice rolls, and turn tracking
  • Highly customizable per actor for layout, theme, and behavior

steps.title: Character Display
steps.content:
This area displays your character’s portrait and current hit points.

Controls

  • Left Click – Open your Character Sheet
  • Right Click – Open the Macro Directory and reset saved Auto Action Tray data

steps.title: Hit Points Display
steps.content:
This area displays the current health of the token.

Controls

  • Left Click – Open the health dialog
  • Enter a discrete value to set current HP
  • Enter a positive or negative value to heal or damage the token

steps.title: Equipment Tray
steps.content:
The Equipment Tray shows automatically selected weapons and attacks for the active token, giving you quick access during play.

Customization

  • Drag any weapon or spell here to replace the selected items

steps.title: Fast Forward
steps.content:
Fast Forward mode streamlines item usage by skipping extra prompts.

Behavior

  • Uses the default activity when activating an item
  • Skips the spell level selection dialog

steps.title: Target Helper
steps.content:
The Target Helper assists with selecting valid targets when using items.

Behavior

  • Displays targeting lines on the canvas
  • Allows you to select targets before resolving the item

steps.title: Tray Configuration
steps.content:
Open the Tray Configuration dialog to customize the Auto Action Tray for this actor.

What You Can Configure

  • Select a tray theme, including class-based and custom themes
  • Adjust target line and range boundary colors
  • Add or clear custom static trays tied to item resources
  • Choose between portrait or token display
  • Fine-tune the character image with scale and position controls
  • Enable visual options like the health indicator
  • Automatically add newly created items to the tray
  • Show or hide class-specific skills

All settings are saved per actor.

steps.title: Range Boundary
steps.content:
Toggle the Range Boundary to visually display the effective range of actions and abilities on the canvas.

Behavior

  • Shows a visual boundary for ability range
  • Uses the configured targeting color

steps.title: Minimize Tray
steps.content:
Minimize the Auto Action Tray to reduce on-screen clutter.

Behavior

  • Hides the tray while keeping it accessible
  • Click the maximize button near the Player List to restore it

steps.title: Lock or Unlock Tray
steps.content:
Lock the Auto Action Tray to prevent accidental movement or layout changes.

Behavior

  • Prevents dragging or repositioning the tray
  • Unlock to move or reconfigure its position

steps.title: Ability Tray
steps.content:
The Ability Tray displays items from the current Custom or Static Tray. This area also shows dialogs for targeting, spell level selection, activity selection, and more.

Enhanced Tooltips

  • All items in the Ability Tray have enhanced tooltips providing additional information
  • Tooltips include estimated damage and other relevant details

Item Notation and Visual Indicators

  • Passive Items – Circular border
  • Container Items – Rounded square border; contents listed in the tooltip
  • Spells – Level shown in the lower right (Roman numerals); '+' in the upper right if upcast; scroll icon in the upper left if a scroll
  • Consumable Charges – Listed in the lower right
  • MultiAttack – If a monster has a MultiAttack feature, the tray detects included attacks and highlights them; duplicate attacks appear multiple times on the bar

steps.title: Static Actions Tray
steps.content:
Static Trays are automatically populated based on item properties and cannot be modified or rearranged.

Common Static Trays

  • Action – Items that cost 1 Action
  • Bonus Action – Items that cost 1 Bonus Action
  • Class Specific – Items that consume a class resource
  • Extra Spells – Spells with limited uses that do not consume spell slots
  • Cantrips – Spells marked as cantrips
  • Leveled Spells – Spells of levels 1–9
  • Rituals – Spells marked as rituals

Items in static trays cannot be dragged or manually edited.

steps.title: Custom Actions Tray
steps.content:
The Custom Actions Tray is initially populated automatically when the tray is first created.

Customization

  • Items can be moved, rearranged, or removed after creation
  • Drag items from your character sheet or other trays to customize it
  • Ideal for frequently used abilities, spells, or macros

Unlike Static Trays, Custom Trays are fully user-editable.

steps.title: Skill & Save Tray
steps.content:
This tray provides quick access to skill checks and saving throws. Hovering over a skill displays its roll bonus.

Pages

  • The tray has two pages, which can be swapped using the Swap Skill Tray Page button
  • The main page contains the most common skills for the class, as well as all saving throws
  • The secondary page contains the remaining skills

Advanced Usage

  • Hold Alt to gain Advantage while rolling
  • Hold Control to apply Disadvantage while rolling

steps.title: Swap Skill Tray Page
steps.content: This button swaps between different pages of the Skill Tray, giving you access to additional skills or saving throws.

steps.title: Condition Tray Toggle
steps.content: Use this button to show or hide the Condition Tray, allowing you to quickly apply or remove status effects from your tokens.

steps.title: Dice & Turn Controls
steps.content:
The Dice & Turn Tray provides quick access to dice rolls and turn tracking.

Out of Combat

  • Dice Tray – Right-click to cycle through dice types, left-click to roll the selected die

In Combat

  • Turn Marker – Shows how long until the actor’s turn
  • During the actor’s turn, displays an End Turn button
